title.rendered: New Smile on Wheels bringing hopes and health to the people of Bengaluru

content.rendered:
A new Smile on Wheels Mobile hospital project has been launched in Bangalore, Karnataka.

The project will make healthcare services accessible at the doorsteps of families living in 15 slums across the city, including Chennasandra Boovi, Sri Ramachandra Slum, Renuka Ellamma temple road slum, Bhuvaneshwari Nagar, Balaji Layout Slum and Vasanthapura Slum.

Powered with a team of qualified doctor, nurse, lab technician, pharmacist, driver and a group of volunteers, the project aims to benefit over 16,000 children and their families directly every year.

The Smile on Wheels programme has so far provided free healthcare services to more than 10 lakh children and families.

Smile Foundation is a national level development organisation directly benefitting over 400,000 children and their families every year, through more than 200 live welfare projects on education, healthcare, livelihood and women empowerment, in over 950 remote villages and slums across 25 states of India.
